hook.text: Black walnut trees poison the soil around them. Tomatoes planted within 50 feet wilt and die.

buildup.text: Allelopathy is the production of chemicals by one plant that inhibit the growth of neighboring plants.

discovery.text: Juglone, released by walnut roots and leaves, disrupts cell respiration in sensitive species like tomato and pepper.

twist.text: Allelopathy isn't always aggressive. Some crops suppress weeds through allelopathic root exudatesâ€”free weed control.

climax.text: Understanding which plants poison their neighbors is just as important as knowing which ones help each other.

punchline.text: Some plants kill neighbors with chemicals, not shade.

quiz.question: What is allelopathy?
options: A plant disease caused by fungal infection
Chemical production by one plant that inhibits growth of neighboring plants
A symbiotic relationship between plant roots and fungi
